body.p: The Board decided on an approach whereby an entity could continue to apply hedge accounting for hedging relationships directly affected by the reform, even if the actual results of the hedging relationship do not meet the requirements in paragraph AG105(b) of IAS 39, if the ineffectiveness arose from uncertainty arising from the reform or other sources, subject to satisfying the other conditions in paragraph 88 of IAS 39, including the prospective assessment (as amended by paragraph 102F of IAS 39).
